title: Everglades National Park: Helicopter Types
body: Helicopter Types       HELICOPTER TYPES The following are characteristics of the three types of helicopters used in wildland fire. These factors are considered when a helicopter is ordered in relation to the missions they are expected to be flying.        Type 1 helicopter. NPS Photo.  Type 1 15 or more passenger seats. Carry up to 700 gallons of water. Maximum weight for taking off or landing 12,501lbs or more.        Type 2 helicopter. NPS Photo.  Type 2 9-14 passenger seats. Carry up to 300 gallons of water. Maximum weight for taking off or landing      6,000-12,500 lbs.        Type 3 helicopter. NPS Photo.  Type 3 4-8 passenger seats. Carry up to 100 gallons of water. Maximum weight for taking off or landing is  up to 6,000 lbs      Information from the Interagency Helicopter Operations Guide, 2006.
